[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@here/harp-mapview](./harp-mapview.md) &gt; [MapViewUtils](./harp-mapview.mapviewutils.md) &gt; [extractTiltAngleFromLocation](./harp-mapview.mapviewutils.extracttiltanglefromlocation.md)

## MapViewUtils.extractTiltAngleFromLocation() function

Gets the tilt angle (in radians) of the object relative to the coordinates of `location`<!-- -->.

Note: this method can be used to get the direction that an object points to, when `location` is the target of that object, by adding PI to it. Otherwise it only returns the tilt angle (in radians) of `object` in the tangent space of `location`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
function extractTiltAngleFromLocation(projection: Projection, object: THREE.Object3D, location: GeoCoordinates): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  projection | [Projection](./harp-geoutils.projection.md) | The \[\[Projection\]\] used when converting from geo to world coordinates. |
|  object | THREE.Object3D | The object to get the coordinates from. |
|  location | [GeoCoordinates](./harp-geoutils.geocoordinates.md) | The reference point. |

<b>Returns:</b>

number
